greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sqrt(2*log(2)).
comment: Constant arising from birthday paradox: if the year has n days, the number of people required so that the probability that at least two of them have the same birthday is 1/2 approaches 1.1774100225...*sqrt(n) for large n.
reference: W. Feller, An Introduction to Probability Theory and Its Applications, Vol. 1, 2nd ed. New York: Wiley, p. 31, 1968.
B. Barwell, Journal of Recreational Mathematics, Soln. to Prob. 2393: "Matching Birthdays on Mars" 30(1) 71 1999-2000.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 20080); x=sqrt(2*log(2)); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b064619.txt", n, " ", d)) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 20 2009
results.author: Henrik Johansson (johansson.henrik(AT)home.se), Jun 06 2002
